events.message: The applicant has submitted a personal loan application to cover medical expenses. They are hopeful for a smooth process and timely approval.
The application was categorised under Personal Loan due to the applicantâ€™s mention of medical bills in the purpose statement.
Loan officer Sarah Thompson has been assigned to this case. She is experienced with personal loans and medical expense cases.
The initial review of the application has been completed. All basic information appears to be provided and accurate.
The applicant was requested to submit medical bills, proof of income, and ID documents to move forward with the loan evaluation.
The applicant has provided all requested documents including detailed medical bills, bank statements, and valid identification.
Credit check was completed to assess the applicant's financial standing, revealing a moderate credit score with no late payments.
A risk assessment was conducted based on credit history and loan purpose. The risk is evaluated as manageable by the underwriting team.
A loan offer was presented to the applicant outlining terms for a $15,000 personal loan for medical expenses at a 7% interest rate.
The applicant responded positively to the loan offer and expressed willingness to proceed with agreed terms promptly.
The application was escalated to senior management for final loan approval due to the loan amount exceeding standard limits.
Senior management approved the personal loan application after reviewing all documentation and risk assessments.
The approved loan amount has been successfully funded and disbursed to the applicant's account to cover medical expenses.
A follow-up call was made to confirm receipt of funds and to check if the applicant requires any assistance navigating repayment options.
The loan application has been formally closed after successful funding and positive post-approval feedback from the applicant.
